intro: Erodium reichardii, commonly known as sticky lentil or redstem stinkweed, is an annual flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible or medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its small, pink to reddish flowers and hairy, glandular leaves that produce a sticky substance. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and other open areas. Due to its invasive potential in some regions, it is sometimes considered a weed.
